snippet: The nation’s No. 3 cellphone carrier reported a fourth-quarter loss of $1.3 billion, or 43 cents a share, on revenue that climbed 5 percent to $8.7 billion.
abstract: Sprint Nextel lifts revenue with the iPhone, but posts a net fourth-quarter loss of $1.3 billion, or 43 cents a share, compared with net loss of $929 million in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: The nation’s No. 3 cellphone carrier reported a fourth-quarter loss of $1.3 billion, or 43 cents a share, on revenue that climbed 5 percent to $8.7 billion.

headline.seo: Sprint Posts a Net Loss Despite a Gain on iPhone
headline.main: Sprint Posts Sales Loss, but iPhone Lifts Revenue
headline.print_headline: Sprint Posts Sales Loss, But iPhone Lifts Revenue
